column4: clujo, i put in all my stuff to hopefully get my graphics card to work with ubuntu, and i restarted the ocmputer and i didnt get the normal vertical colered line pattern, it brought up a menu that was messed up around the edges and said that the x server wasnt set up correctly
oh lol
ok

jorden_u, you helped me last night some, i put in all my stuff to hopefully get my graphics card to work with ubuntu, and i restarted the ocmputer and i didnt get the normal vertical colered line pattern, it brought up a menu that was messed up around the edges and said that the x server wasnt set up correctly
why does ubuntu hate geforce cards?
funny
I don't remember your problem from before, have you tried: sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg -phigh and choosing nvidia ?
I remember now.
Did it ever get past: sudo apt-get update?
Couldn't hurt.
NO.
To restart type: sudo reboot , but there is one more command you can try ( although rebooting will have the same effect )
sudo /etc/init.d/?dm restart ( to see if your graphics work )
Restart without the install CD in the drive.
What is the output of: glxinfo | grep renderer ( should only be one line ) ?
glxinfo | grep renderer
What do you mean include?
No, that was the correct command, it just didn't give the output I expected.
Run glxinfo and see if you can tell where it says what driver you are using.
Yes.
To be clear, you only type "glxinfo"
At this point I am stumped, try #ubuntu-xgl ( I will be there also )
